descriptions.description: More core developers increase the availability of mentors, facilitating implicit knowledge transfer.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the potential candidate flow for promotion.
As new contributors skill up, they flow out of the 'New Contributors' stock into more experienced roles.
Developer turnover directly reduces the stock of core developers as they leave the project.
A higher promotion rate increases the core developer stock by adding experienced contributors.
A higher promotion rate decreases the stock of experienced contributors as they move into core roles.
The skill-up flow increases the stock of experienced contributors by advancing new contributors.
Better explicit knowledge transfer, like documentation, accelerates the skill-up process for contributors.
Effective implicit mentorship accelerates learning and skill development for contributors.
Strong mentorship prepares experienced contributors for core responsibilities, increasing their promotion rate.
